chargeHist.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.execSummary:
All charges against Daniel Mark Hendrickson in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Daniel Mark Hendrickson is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel Mark Hendrickson

records.addlTxt: 10:03 AM Prosecuting attorney Michael Joseph Becker in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Daniel Mark Hendrickson in court.  Attorney Jeremiah James Harrelson in court for Daniel Mark Hendrickson.  Includes 21CF753 & 22CF7. Atty Harrelson recites agreement states he will withdraw all motions filed.  ADA Becker agrees to recommendation, no restitution being requested.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to AMENDED Ct 1- Financial Transaction Card- Theft by Other Violations 943.41(3)(e) Repeater 939.62(1)(b) in 21CF753. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 in 21CF753.  On motion of the State without objection, Crt dismisses Ct 2-6 in 21CF753 & 22CF7 with prejudice. Parties are requesting a PSI.  ADA Becker not seeking remand. Court makes statements to DE regarding cooperating with Agent.  ADA Becker will file a new amended information to include sub 1. Adjourned at 10:32 AM. bph

10:01 AM  Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, ADA: Michael Joseph Becker, DF ATTY: Jeremiah James Harrelson, DF: Daniel Mark Hendrickson appeared from jail.  Includes 22CF7 (PH) & 21CF753 (STC). S/T of Deputy Joseph Bradac of St. Croix County Sheriff Jail.  Direct by ADA Becker. Cross by Atty. Harrelson.  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial.  Atty. Harrelson states he'll need more time to review discovery on 21CF753.  Court questions when DE is scheduled for release, Atty. Harrelson states DE is to be released on 3/4/22.   DE verified address and phone number.  DE understands he will need to keep Court updated with good address and phone number.  Bond continues.  Court orders DE to sign Pre- Signed Waiver of Extradition. Adjourned at 10:34 AM. bph  Arraignment scheduled for March 30, 2022 at 09:15 am.

TO ALSO INCLUDE 21CF753 & 22CF7

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Heidi's Hallmark, I.J.B., or M.K.C.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.
